column2: With new technological advances, the giant iron reserves in Kiruna are finally ready for full exploitation.
Thanks to new explosive Nitroglycerin, we can expand our mining operations even further.

Our mining operations are now in full swing and the reserves will not be depleted for centuries. By improving living conditions in the arctic climate for our miners, we can increase our yield for generations to come!
With new rail technology, we can expand our operation even further!
Our miners have hit a new rich deposit of iron ore in our Kiruna Iron Mine. We have not yet explored it fully, but are certain of a huge increase of iron production.
Our rainforest is the largest on Earth. Many beautiful and, most importantly, expensive types of timber can be found here. We should make full use of our resources.
Timber is heated into charcoal for further industrial applications
Wool is woven into fabric and dyed here

With the loss of our New World holdings and consolidation of India, we have large deficits left to fill and yet we were unable to prevent the wealth we had left from spilling into Qing coffers. The growing demand for chinese goods in Europe has far outscaled any efforts to wrestle their monopoly away on tea and silk. However, the climate in India is suitable for poppy production, allowing us to exchange opium for tea at an unprecedented scale. Unfortunately, the Qing have begun to notice this activity and while undoubtedly clamp down on the trade.
After the Qing officials at the Canton port confiscated and destroyed a sizable reserve of opium, many demand compensation.

The overstretched Spanish military build-up in the Eastern Spanish Protectorate in Morocco crumbled. After the battle, the Rifians advanced eastward and overran more than 130 Spanish blockhouses. The Spanish garrisons were destroyed without mounting a coordinated response to the attacks. By the end of August, Spain had lost all the territories that it had gained in the area since 1909. General Silvestre disappeared and his remains were never found. According to one report, Spanish sergeant Francisco Basallo Becerra from the Kandussi garrison, an outpost east of Annual, identified the remains of Silvestre by his general's sash. A Moorish courier from Kaddur Namar said that eight days after the battle, he saw the corpse of the general lying face down on the battlefield and still recognizable by his sash and epaulettes.
Chicken meat is cheap (war will be declared)

In July 1909, Spanish workers constructing a rail-bridge providing access to iron mines near Melilla were attacked by Rifian tribesmen. This incident led to the summoning of reinforcements from Spain itself. A series of skirmishes over the following weeks cost the Spanish over a thousand casualties. By September, the Spanish Army had 40,000 troops in northern Morocco and had occupied the tribal regions to the south and southeast of Melilla. The military operations in Jebala, in the Moroccan west, began in 1911 with the Larache landing. Spain worked to pacify a large part of the most violent areas until 1914, a slow process of consolidation of frontiers that lasted until 1919, due to World War I. The following year, after the signing of the Treaty of Fez, the northern Moroccan area was adjudicated to Spain as a protectorate. The Riffian populations strongly resisted the Spanish, unleashing a conflict that would last for several years.

Resurrected by crackpipe opium users Lu Bu returns to China as a demigod no longer bound by Dong Zhuos patricidal oath of honor. He reigns above all who witness him, those who follow are given weapons to usher in a new age of dominion by the slaying of dissenters that may try to poison his movement. Enraged by western posturing, he sees them as Cao Cao reincarnate put forth to demolish what he was put here to do. He will stop at nothing until the western Cao Cao is utterly decimated

I write this report from the frontline of the ongoing conquest led by the formidable Warlord Lu Bu, whose insatiable hunger for power has plunged the world into a maelstrom of chaos and devastation. The ground beneath our feet trembles as Lu Bu's unstoppable forces advance with an inexorable determination. His army, a formidable and disciplined force, leaves no room for opposition. The clash of steel, the thunderous hooves of cavalry, and the roar of siege engines reverberate across the landscape as cities crumble in the wake of his conquering horde. The conquered territories are subjected to a brutal occupation. Cities once thriving with life now lay in ruins, their streets stained with the blood of both combatants and innocent civilians. The once vibrant landscapes are transformed into grim reminders of the price paid for resisting Lu Bu's dominion.

In a dramatic and unprecedented turn of events, the seemingly unstoppable march of Warlord Lu Bu's conquest has met a climactic end at the hands of an international coalition determined to halt his reign of terror. Today marks a historic chapter as forces from various nations joined together to face the formidable adversary head-on.The battle reached its climax as the coalition's forces managed to encircle and isolate Lu Bu from his command center. Despite his legendary combat skills, the Warlord found himself overwhelmed by the sheer force of the coordinated assault. The turning tide became apparent as the allied generals strategically exploited weaknesses in Lu Bu's defenses, gradually wearing down his forces. As the dust settled on the battlefield, the once indomitable Lu Bu was forced to concede defeat. The international coalition emerged victorious, marking the end of an era defined by tyranny and unbridled ambition. The conquered territories, long held captive by fear, erupted in a mixture of relief and jubilation as news of the coalition's success spread.

I pen this missive to you as a last opportunity for reason before the storm that shall soon befall you and your pitiful forces. The winds of war are at our backs, and the drums of impending doom resonate in every footstep of my advancing army. Let it be known that my patience wears thin, and the time for negotiation is swiftly closing its door. I, Lu Bu, Warlord of the, demand your immediate and unconditional surrender. Your defiance has not gone unnoticed, but your feeble attempts at resistance will only prolong the agony that awaits you. Should you choose to ignore this final warning, the consequences shall be severe and unforgiving. My forces are relentless, and I will not hesitate to unleash the full fury of my wrath upon your lands. You will witness the annihilation of all you hold dear ? your armies will crumble, your cities will burn, and your people will be subjected to a fate so gruesome that it will be spoken of in hushed tones for generations to come. Do not delude yourself into thinking that help will come to your aid, for I have cast a shadow so vast that no ally can emerge from it. Resistance is futile, and your only sensible course of action is to submit to my will. Surrender now, and perhaps I will be merciful in victory. Delay, and you shall face a calamity that will haunt the annals of history as a testament to your arrogance and folly. Choose wisely, for the consequences of your decision are upon you.

The conquered country is subjected to a harsh and uncompromising rule under Lu Bu's iron fist. Those who resist face brutal reprisals, and dissent is swiftly crushed. The once-thriving economy is plundered for the spoils of war, and the populace is subjected to heavy taxation and forced labor. The devastation wrought by Lu Bu's conquest is not only physical but also psychological. The people are left traumatized, their sense of security shattered. The scars of war run deep, and the conquered country is forever changed by the ruthless ambition of Lu Bu and his insatiable lust for power. The legacy of his conquest serves as a grim reminder of the price paid by those who dared to oppose the might of the Warlord.

When Alexander II ascended the throne in 1855, the largely peasant conscripted army in the Crimean war was a national disgrace, and clearly demonstrated that despite its large size, the Russian army was no longer competitive to smaller industrial powers such as Britain and France. The demand for reform was widespread, but unorganized. There had been little consideration of how the complex economic, social, political, and legal roles of the service would be ended. The Tsar decided to abolish serfdom from above, setting up a new system whereby the state would be able to purchase farmland from the landowners and sell it to the freed serfs. The Tsar told Moscow nobles: "Better that the reform should come from above than wait until serfdom is abolished from below. Historians have debated Alexander's role. Soviet era historians downplayed him, as they believed social forces caused history not individuals. Non-Marxist critics say he did not go far enough, especially since he rejected any parliament or duma.

A map of the sparsely populated Wild Fields in the 17th century It was at this point that the name Donbas came into use, derived from the term "Donets Coal Basin" referring to the area along the Donets river where most of the coal reserves were found. The rise of the coal industry led to a population boom in the region, largely driven by Russian settlers.

A member of the House of Habsburg-Lorraine, Maximilian was the younger brother of Emperor Franz Joseph I of Austria. Prior to his becoming Emperor of Mexico, he was commander-in-chief of the small Imperial Austrian Navy and briefly the Austrian viceroy of Lombardy-Venetia, but was removed by the emperor. Two years before his dismissal, he briefly met with French emperor Napoleon III in Paris, where he was approached by conservative Mexican monarchists seeking a European royal to rule Mexico. Initially Maximilian was not interested, but following his dismissal as viceroy, the Mexican monarchists' plan was far more appealing to him.

Safavid textiles are praised as the pinnacle of Iranian loom weaving. When the Safavids came to power at the turn of the sixteenth century, the Iranian textile industry was already well developed in the production and sale of woven silk textiles and rugs as well as raw silk for export. The textile industry consisted of urban workshops producing textiles independently, provincial centers focusing on rug weaving, and small farms cultivating silk in the Caspian region. As the Safavids set up their capital cities of Tabriz, Qazvin, and finally Isfahan, the textile industry became centralized and was swiftly incorporated into the national economy, creating an expansive revenue stream. After the death of Shah eAbbas in 1629, the Safavid dynasty began to lose central power, and regional governance relegated the monarch to the position of a figurehead. Textile production in court-sponsored workshops declined, while the private sector of the textile industry regained independence, producing silks for the expanding international demand. From the last quarter of the seventeenth century until the dynastyfs end following the Afghan invasion in 1722, there was a marked change in the textiles produced as Iranian weavers stepped down their aesthetic and working methods to suit the tastes and economy of the declining regime.

That was when everything shook... The sky seemed to be splitting from end to end and raining down sheets of flame. My whole being went tense and I tightened my grip on the gun. The trigger gave, I felt the underside of the polished butt and it was there, in that sharp but deafening noise, that it all started. I realized that I'd destroyed the balance of the day and the perfect silence of this beach where I'd been happy. And I fired four more times at a lifeless body and the bullets sank without leaving a mark. And it was like giving four sharp knocks at the door of unhappiness.
You know what you must do

It was as if that great rush of anger had washed me clean, emptied me of hope, and, gazing up at the dark sky spangled with its signs and stars, for the first time, the first, I laid my heart open to the benign indifference of the universe. To feel it so like myself, indeed, so brotherly, made me realize that I'd been happy, and that I was happy still. For all to be accomplished, for me to feel less lonely, all that remained to hope was that on the day of my execution there should be a huge crowd of spectators and that they should greet me with howls of execration.

Most of the region now occupied by the Landes forest was swampy land that was sparsely inhabited until the 19th century, when the 19 June 1857 law ended traditional pastoralism and led to wide scale reforestation, in order to rehabilitate the landscape and provide for regional economic development. Prior to this period, the people of the Landes used stilt-walking to move from place to place in the wet terrain. Since the 1970s, parts of the forest have given way to intensive agriculture.

The United Netherlands was created in the aftermath of the Napoleonic Wars through the fusion of territories that had belonged to the former Dutch Republic and Austrian Netherlands in order to form a buffer state between the major European powers. The polity collapsed in 1830 with the outbreak of the Belgian Revolution. With the de facto secession of Belgium, the Netherlands was left as a rump state and refused to recognise Belgian independence. Now it is time to reunite our people into the United Kingdom of the Netherlands!

After the defeat of Napoleon in 1815, the Duchy of Luxemburg was restored. At the Congress of Vienna the great powers decided that Luxemburg would become a member state of the newly formed German Confederation, but at the same time William I of the Netherlands, the King of the Netherlands, would become, in personal union, the head of state. Now we shall make it a integral part of the Netherlands.
